label: Tab Multi Client
info:
**This works on MacOS only. **

This page sets up 
 - starts multiple ZoomOSC clients to connect a single meeting. 
 - starts multiple NDI Scan Converter sessions
- Provides a control interface to manage who is pinned on each cleint session.

Many of the other groups send their traffic to the incoming link.

name: format command

format command
Details on running multiple copies of Scan Converter
format usertable MC
Instructions (scroll)
format:
Instructions

  1. Fill in the parameters desired. Press Save. (There is a set defaults button to prepopulate the parameters.)
  2. Launch the ZoomOSC clients (below). The first client "prefix01" will also serve as the controller.
  3. After the clients are launched, then you will need to click on the session icon on the dock for each one to finish the startup.
  4. Make the first client the host
  5. Click on the Initialize clients button. This will set the subscription level for the controller, mute all slaves and turn off their video cameras. The virtual backgrounds are turned on to aid in setup. They can be turned off setup. .
  6. Launch the fleet of NDI Scan Converters. There will be one for each ZoomOSC session. Please be aware that if you are running 8+ slaves you are running the risk of saturating a 1GB network.
  7. You will now need to visit each instance of NDI Scan converter and configure their source to be one of the ZoomOSC slave clients. There is no easy way to identify the correct ZoomOSC session to be used by each scan converter, it is an educated guessing game. The window resolutions are helpful. It is helpful to monitor you choices via a NDI monitor.
  8. After it is all setup, your can set each ZoomOSC session to full screen. You cannot do this before the scan converter config as scan converter cannot fund them.
  9. Turn of virtual backgrounds.

name: Set message
func:
msg = { "instance" : msg.instance,
        "port"     : msg.instance + parseInt(global.get("zoomosc_port"))-1,
        "payload"  : { "type" : "i",
                        "value" : msg.selectedid},
        "topic"    : "/zoom/zoomId/Pin"
}

return msg;

name: ZoomOSC command line options
info:
-m (meeting ID)
-p (meeting password)
-u (username)
-ami (joining mic audio device id)
-asi (joining speaker audio device id)
-ci (camera id)
-rxp (osc receive port)
-txp (osc transmit port)
-txip (osc transmit ip)

-ajo is for auto join only and should be set to 1, though this feature is experimental.

Save Name
Intro
format:
This application provides a management interface for ZoomOSC. It can be used in two different ways.
  1. For a single ZoomOSC instance.
  2. For a fleet of ZoomOSC clients that can be used to provide isolated (pinned) feeds of several participants which you can grab using Newtek's NDI Scan Converter.
There is a different tab for each of those two functions.

There are other tabs for Diagnostics, and Testing which are intended for me as a developer and may not live in the final product.

One this page there are arrows in the upper right corner of each section which can be collapsed to save screen space.

name: Single
format: At the bottom of the page is a list of meeting participants. Select a participant and then using the session buttons you can assign that particpant to particular zoom session.

name: Multi
format:
This contoller creates isolated feeds of multiple Zoom participants. The video from each participant delivered via its own high resoltuion isolated NDI stream. The major functions are:
  • Launching a fleet of ZoomOSC clients
  • Launching a fleet of NDI Scan Converters
  • Setting default behaviours for the ZoomOSC fleet
  • Assistance for connecting the scan converters to the ZoomOSC sessions (virtual background controls)
  • Controls to Pin participants to ZoomOSC clients
  • Controls to tear down the ZoomOSC and scan converter instances
Note: All of the ZoomOSC and Scan Convereter processes must run on the same machine. If the computer has a 1GB network port, you will likely be limited to 8 sessions. CPU resources may further restrict the numbers.

This controller manages the launching of multiple ZoomOSC clients, configuring a prototype of a feature intended to create multiple zoomOSC clients on a single machine. Each client would pin a particular partiicpant. And then each pinned session would be captured by NDI Scan Converter.


At the bottom of the page is a list of meeting participants. Select a participant and then using the session buttons you can assign that particpant to particular zoom session.


There are arrows in the upper right corner of each section which can be collapsed to save screen sapce.

name: Management
format:
One this tab there are controls for: Joining, Leaving and Ending Meetings.

This is also where you configure the IP addresses for the main control session and the multi-client sessions. At this time the multi-client sessions must all be on the same machine as zoomred and also must be on a Mac.

Main Client - Join

This instructs the main client join a designated meeting.

Main Client - End/Leave

These buttons instruct the main client to Leave or End a meeting.

label: Gallery Tracking
tooltip: Changes gallery tracking mode to participantID or zoomID.

label: Subscription Level
tooltip: Sets subscription level for user output data.
